The three trainings [an3.87:5.1]: The training in the higher ethics
The training in the higher mind
The training in the higher wisdom
The ending of fetters [an3.87:5.1]: With the ending of three fetters, they have at most seven rebirths
With the ending of three fetters, they go from family to family
With the ending of three fetters, they’re a one-seeder
With the ending of three fetters, and the weakening of greed, hate, and delusion, they’re a once-returner
The ending of the five lower fetters (a: With the ending of the five lower fetters they head upstream, going to the Akaniṭṭha realm
With the ending of the five lower fetters they’re extinguished with extra effort
With the ending of the five lower fetters they’re extinguished without extra effort
With the ending of the five lower fetters they’re extinguished upon landing
With the ending of the five lower fetters they’re extinguished between one life and the next
The cases of mendicants who have fulfill: Take the case of a mendicant who has fulfilled their ethics, but has limited immersion and wisdom
Take another case of a mendicant who has fulfilled their ethics and immersion, but has limited wisdom
Take another case of a mendicant who has fulfilled their ethics, immersion, and wisdom
The benefits of practicing fully [an3.87: If you practice partially you succeed partially
If you practice fully you succeed fully
